entry.tran: 全职的;专职的;全日制的
entry.def: Full-time work or study involves working or studying for the whole of each normal working week rather than for part of it.
If you describe a regular activity or task as a full-time job, you mean that it takes up so much of your time it is like doing a paid job.

example.ex: The way she did it, mothering was a full-time job.
example.tran: 照顾孩子于她是一件不得空闲的苦差事。

entry.def: In games such as football, full-time is the end of a match.

example.ex: The score at full-time was Arsenal 1, Sampdoria 1.
example.tran: 比赛结束时阿森纳队和桑普多利亚队 1 比 1 战平。

means.word_mean: 1. for the entire time appropriate to an activity;
1. for the standard number of hours;
